page.title: 06A FARMER'S DAY
page.content: I get up early on a sunny June morning. I milk the cows ready for the milk lorry to collect the milk from the bulk tank. Feeding the calves is quick with powdered milk and a little hay. Breakfast time is over fast today as thehay mown yesterday must be turned and wuffled ready for baling. After turng the hay I fetch my dog and so in the landrover to check all the heifers, bullocks, sheep and horses. After dinnerI start the hay but my tractor needs attention. The mechanic is called and quickly repairs the fault. By tea time the field is baled and ready for the flat eight machine to put them on the trailer. Tomorrow all the bales will be elevated up into the Dutch barn to keep the silage in place. After tea I again milk the cows, feed the calves and the dog. My day finishes at 9.00.I a tired but happy with my day's work.
